meanings.definition: To reshape or redefine the contours of something.
meanings.sent1: She is recontouring the garden to make it more visually appealing.
meanings.sent2: The artist is recontouring the sculpture to capture the essence of movement.
meanings.sent3: The chef recontoured the cake into a whimsical shape for the party.
meanings.sent4: Her words recontoured his perspective on the situation, revealing a new angle.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight recontouring the landscape created a breathtaking scene.

meanings.definition: The act of altering the shape or structure of something.
meanings.sent1: The recontouring of the mountain was a massive engineering project.
meanings.sent2: After the recontouring of the road, traffic flow improved significantly.
meanings.sent3: The recontouring of the building made it look like a giant puzzle piece.
meanings.sent4: The recontouring of the coastline over centuries is evident in the rock formations.
meanings.sent5: The recontouring of the garden transformed it into a peaceful sanctuary.
